resources.string: Allows this application to control K-9 Mail activities and settings.
Copyright 2008-%s The K-9 Dog Walkers. Portions Copyright 2006-%s the Android Open Source Project.
Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0.

K-9 Mail is a powerful free email client for Android.

Its improved features include:

  • Push mail using IMAP IDLE
  • Better performance
  • Message refiling
  • Email signatures
  • Bcc-to-self
  • Folder subscriptions
  • All folder synchronization
  • Return-address configuration
  • Keyboard shortcuts
  • Better IMAP support
  • Saving attachments to SD
  • Empty Trash
  • Message sorting
  • …and more

Please note that K-9 does not support most free Hotmail accounts and, like many mail clients, has some quirks when talking to Microsoft Exchange.

Please submit bug reports, contribute new features and ask questions at http://k9mail.googlecode.com/.
-- \nSent from my Android device with K-9 Mail. Please excuse my brevity.
Are you sure to remove Email account \"%s\" ?
All local data for \"%s\" will be removed. Account settings will be retained.
Local copies of messages in \"%s\" will be removed. Account settings will be retained.
K-9 doesn\'t have permission to access APG fully, please reinstall K-9 to fix that.
Please install a file manager to continue with this import.
We\'re using the following third-party libraries: %s
Allows this application to read your Email attachments.
Allows this application to read your Emails.
Allows this application to delete your Emails.
You must add at least one recipient.
No email address could be found for this contact.
Some attachments cannot be forwarded because they have not been downloaded
Attachment saved to SD card as %s.
Unable to save attachment to SD card.
Not all headers have been downloaded or saved. Select \"Save all headers locally\" in the account\'s incoming server settings to enable this for the future.
All headers have been downloaded, but there are no additional headers to show.
The retrieval of additional headers from the database or mail server failed.
Show correspondent names rather than their email addresses
Show correspondent names above the subject line, rather than below it
Use recipient names from Contacts when available
Don\'t colorize names in your contact list
Colorize names in your contact list
Use multiple lines to show long folder names
Use a fixed-width font when showing plain-text messages
Shrink messages to fit the screen
Return to message list after message deletion
Show next message by default after message deletion
Show a dialog whenever you perform selected actions
Remove K-9 User-Agent from mail headers
Use UTC as time zone in mail headers
Show a button in the notification that allows quick message deletion
Disable ringing, buzzing and flashing at night
Type your name (displays on outgoing messages):
What kind of account is this?
Enable push mail for this account
If your server supports it, new messages will appear instantly. This option can dramatically improve or hurt performance.
Notify me while mail is being checked
Cannot copy or move a message that is not synchronized with the server

The server presented an invalid SSL certificate. Sometimes, this is because of a server misconfiguration. Sometimes it is because someone is trying to attack you or your mail server. If you\'re not sure what\'s up, click Reject and contact the folks who manage your mail server.\n\n(%s)
Send mail from this account by default
Notify in status bar when mail arrives
Notify in status bar while mail is checked
Show a notification for messages I sent
Searches for unread messages when Notification is opened
Mark a message as read when it is opened for viewing
Include the original message in your reply.
The original message will appear above your reply.
Signatures will be removed from quoted messages
Use the account\'s email address to guess the signature key.
Automatically set encrypt if a public key matches a recipient.
The accent color of this account used in folder and account list
The color your device LED should blink for this account
Remove messages when deleted on server
Show near the top of the folder list
Set your default From, Bcc and signature
Set up alternate \'From\' addresses and signatures
You can\'t remove your only identity
You can\'t use an identity without an email address
Be sure to enable IMAP or POP3 on the au one mail settings page.
Be sure to enable IMAP or POP3 on the Naver mail settings page.
Be sure to enable IMAP or POP3 on the Hanmail(Daum) mail settings page.

Del (or D) - Delete
R - Reply
A - Reply All
C - Compose
F - Forward
M - Move
V - Archive
Y - Copy
Z - Mark (Un)read
G - Star
O - Sort type
I - Sort order
Q - Return to Folders
S - Select/deselect
J or P - Previous Message
K or N - Next Message

1 - Display only 1st Class folders
2 - Display 1st and 2nd Class folders
3 - Display all except 2nd Class folders
4 - Display all folders
Q - Return to Accounts
S - Edit Account Settings
Select the message view theme while viewing the message
Use a fixed message view theme
Max folders to check with push
Hide the unified inbox and all messages accounts
Tap envelope or star for unread or starred messages
All messages are shown in Unified Inbox
No suitable application for this action found.
The installed APG version is not supported.
PGP/MIME messages are not supported yet.
Warning: attachments are NOT signed or encrypted yet.
Are you sure you want to discard this message?
Refuse to save draft message marked encrypted.
One or more recipients do not have a saved public key. Continue?
